newsitem.title: UK: NWE gasoline firm as moderate NYMEX gains support.
newsitem.headline: NWE gasoline firm as moderate NYMEX gains support.

text.p: NWE gasoline was firm on Tuesday helped by moderate gains in the NYMEX unleaded contract, traders said.
Eurograde barges traded at $202.25 and $202.50 a tonne fob AR in early trade, while 2,000 tonnes of Eurograde material was bought by a U.K. player at $201 later.
Regular was quoted in a wide price band ranging $191.50/$196.
Traders attributed the larger than usual price spread between Eurograde and regular material to a dearth of interest in regular grade.
Others also attributed it to Eurograde quotes some $2 too high.

A number of players looked to move material to the United States. Traders are looking for a price differential between Rotterdam May barges and the June NYMEX of around $23 to make the arbitrage work.
Some said potential exporters would have to move promptly to make the trip work.
At around 1700 GMT the differential between May barges/June unleaded stood around $23.80, while between May barges/July unleaded it was just $20.

A Belgian refiner was reported to have sold a transatlantic cargo late on Tuesday, but this was not confirmed. Traders estimated a price around July NYMEX unleaded -$6.0. -- Melanie Goodfellow, London Newsroom, +44 171 542 7714.
